item.title: Does woman with below average intelligence have no right to be a mother? Bombay High Court asks - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Bombay High Court Addresses Rights of Pregnant Woman with Below Average Intelligence

Published on: 08 Jan 2025, 7:44 am

The Bombay High Court ruled on a case involving a 27-year-old pregnant woman, whose adoptive father sought to terminate her pregnancy due to her below-average intelligence. The court reaffirmed her right to motherhood amid questions about her mental capacity.

  • The woman, over 20 weeks pregnant, refused consent for abortion.
  • A medical board found both the woman and the foetus to be physically normal.
  • The court highlighted that having below-average intelligence does not negate her right to be a mother.
  • The father adopted the woman when she was six months old and expressed concerns about her mental health and ability to care for a child.
  • The court emphasized parental responsibility and urged the father to support his daughter's choices.
"Observation is she has below average intelligence. Nobody can be super intelligent.. we are human beings, everybody has different level of intelligence. Because she has below average intelligence, she has no right to be a mother?"

The case is set to continue on January 13, during which the court will determine if the woman's partner is willing to marry her.

item.title: ‘Obscene remarks’ against actor Honey Rose: Businessman Boby Chemmanur taken into Kerala Police custody - The Indian Express
item.description:
Businessman Boby Chemmanur in Custody for Obscene Remarks Against Actor Honey Rose

Date: Wednesday
Source: Indian Express

Kerala Police took businessman Boby Chemmanur into custody on Wednesday for making obscene remarks about Malayalam actor Honey Rose. The case stemmed from comments made during a jewelry showroom inauguration and social media harassment.

Honey Rose filed a complaint against Chemmanur along with around 30 others, claiming she was subjected to sexist comments online. She stated, "You (Chemmanur) believe in money power, I believe in the country’s legal system." Chemmanur denied any wrongdoing, claiming his remarks were misunderstood.

  • Chemmanur was arrested after police registered a case against him.
  • Honey Rose reported psychological distress due to ongoing harassment.
  • Prominent figures in the film industry have shown support for Honey Rose.
Honey Rose expressed relief at the arrest, stating, "I was being stalked and targeted repeatedly... I should have reacted much earlier."

The incident has been widely discussed in Kerala, raising awareness about harassment and reinforcing support for the actor.

item.title: Nitin Gadkari announces nationwide cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims - The Hindu
item.description:
Nitin Gadkari announces nationwide cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Central government is set to implement a cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims, allowing up to ₹1.5 lakh per person for medical care.

  • The scheme will be applicable for all road accidents involving motor vehicles.
  • The National Health Authority will coordinate the implementation with various agencies.
  • It will function via a new IT platform integrating existing applications for accident management.
  • The pilot programme previously launched in Chandigarh will be expanded nationwide by March 2025.
  • Additional discussions on driver fatigue and vehicle safety measures were highlighted during the recent workshop.
“The broad contours of the pilot programme are -- victims entitled to cashless treatment up to a maximum of ₹1.5 lakh per accident per person for a maximum period of 7 days from the date of the accident.” - Nitin Gadkari

This initiative aims to provide timely medical assistance to accident victims across India, addressing critical needs in emergency response.

item.title: Sale By Way Of Public Auction Can't Be Set Aside Unless There's Material Irregularity Or Fraud/Collusion... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Sale By Way Of Public Auction Can't Be Set Aside Unless There's Material Irregularity Or Fraud/Collusion

Publication Date: Not specified Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has reiterated that public auction sales cannot be set aside unless there is a material irregularity, illegality, fraud, or collusion involved in the auction process.

  • The Court cited V.S. Palanivel vs. P. Sriram which established that without serious flaws in the conduct of the auction, it should not be set aside.
  • A recent ruling in Celir LLP vs Ms Sumati Prasad Bafna and others confirmed that mere procedural irregularities do not justify the annulment of confirmed sales unless they are fundamental.
  • Justice BV Nagaratna and Justice NK Singh emphasized the principle that without material irregularities, auctions should typically be upheld to avoid chaos in transactions.
  • The Supreme Court reversed a Delhi High Court decision that invalidated an auction under the SARFAESI Act 2002.
  • The borrower had several opportunities to redeem the mortgage, and an alleged possessory claim was dismissed due to lack of valid documentation.
  • The auction was conducted following statutory requirements, making it a valid sale.
“It is now a well-settled principle that a sale by way of public auction cannot be set aside until there is any material irregularity and/or illegality committed in holding the auction or if such auction was vitiated by any fraud or collusion.”

The Supreme Court's ruling aims to uphold the integrity of auction sales and ensure that legitimate transactions are not disrupted due to minor irregularities.

item.title: Railways unveils Vande Bharat, specially designed for winters in J&K, for Katra-Srinagar route - The Hindu
item.description:
Railways unveils winter-ready Vande Bharat for Katra-Srinagar route

Date: January 08, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Railway Board on January 8, 2025, launched a Vande Bharat Express train tailored for the extreme winter conditions of Jammu & Kashmir, aimed at enhancing connectivity for the Katra-Srinagar route, which is currently under safety inspection.

  • The train incorporates special climate adaptations for operations in severe winter conditions.
  • It features advanced heating systems to prevent freezing of key components.
  • Embedded heating elements in the windshield provide defrosting for clearer visibility.
  • Standard amenities include fully air-conditioned coaches and mobile charging sockets.
  • Significant for connecting the Kashmir Valley to the national railway network.
“It has advanced heating systems which prevent freezing of water tank and bio-toilet tanks, ensuring air-brake system functions optimally for smooth operations even in sub-zero temperatures,” said Dileep Kumar, Executive Director (Information & Publicity), Railway Board.

This innovative train represents a major step in India's effort to enhance connectivity in the challenging terrains of Jammu & Kashmir, symbolizing a commitment to reducing geographical and economic disparities.

item.title: V. Narayanan, who is set to take over as ISRO Chairman, terms his new assignment ‘a great responsibility’ - The Hindu
item.description:
V. Narayanan Set to Lead ISRO with Great Responsibility

Published on: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

V. Narayanan, a rocket propulsion expert, will take over as the Chairman of ISRO on January 14, 2025. He describes this new role as a significant responsibility and opportunity to lead ISRO during a transformative time in India's space sector.

  • Succeeds S. Somanath as ISRO Chairman.
  • ISRO has several major projects lined up including Gaganyaan, Chandrayaan-4, and an Indian space station.
  • Dr. Narayanan emphasizes the importance of increasing India's presence in space and the role of private sector reforms in achieving this goal.
  • He has a substantial background in rocket propulsion, having been with ISRO since 1984.
“Towards January-end we have the GSLV Mk-II/IRNSS-1 K mission... we have our hands full.”

In conclusion, Dr. Narayanan's extensive experience and vision for reform will be crucial as ISRO embarks on its ambitious future projects.

item.title: Ramesh Bidhuri to be replaced? Unease in BJP ahead of Delhi election: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Unease in BJP Over Ramesh Bidhuri's Controversial Remarks Ahead of Delhi Elections

January 08, 2025 - Hindustan Times

BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri’s recent controversial remarks about Delhi chief minister Atishi and Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra have sparked a backlash, leading to discussions within the party about replacing him with a woman candidate for the upcoming assembly election.

  • There have been at least two organisational meetings regarding Bidhuri's candidacy.
  • His remarks led to a reprimand from BJP leader JP Nadda.
  • Potential women replacements for Bidhuri are being discussed.
  • Bidhuri commented on Atishi's family name change, which drew criticism.
“Not just against Atishi, Rameshji’s statement on Priyanka Gandhi Vadra led to his being reprimanded by Naddaji within minutes,” a BJP source stated.

The situation highlights internal tensions in the BJP as it prepares for the February 5 assembly election.

item.title: At Maha Kumbh Camp, Agra Teen Decides To Become 'Sadhvi'. Parents 'Donate' Her, 'Pind Daan' To Follow - News18
item.description:
Agra Teen Becomes 'Sadhvi' at Maha Kumbh Camp After Spiritual Awakening

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: News18

A 13-year-old girl from Agra has chosen to renounce worldly life and become a 'sadhvi' during her visit to the Maha Kumbh camp in Prayagraj. Her parents supported this decision, viewing it as God's wish.

  • The girl's name is Rakhi, and she had dreamed of becoming an IAS officer before her spiritual awakening.
  • Her mother, Reema Singh, noted that her daughter felt a strong detachment from worldly life while at the camp.
  • The family was invited to serve at the Maha Kumbh by Mahant Kaushal Giri Maharaj.
  • Rakhi will undergo 'pind daan' and other rituals on January 19, marking her formal acceptance into the ashram where she will be known as Gauri Giri.
“The decision was made without any coercion. It was God’s wish.” - Reema Singh, Rakhi's mother.

This event highlights a significant shift in a young girl's life, showcasing her dedication to spiritual pursuits over conventional aspirations.

item.title: 1 body recovered as forces resume operation to rescue trapped coal miners in Assam - The Times of India
item.description:
1 Body Recovered as Forces Resume Operation to Rescue Trapped Coal Miners in Assam

Date: October 2023 Source: The Economic Times

Rescue operations have resumed in Assam after the recovery of one body of a coal miner. Efforts continue to locate the remaining trapped miners.

  • One body has been recovered while others remain missing.
  • Rescue teams are engaged in ongoing operations to find the trapped individuals.
  • The incident has highlighted safety concerns in coal mining operations.
"We are working diligently to ensure everyone's safety and get the missing miners out as soon as possible," a rescue official stated.

The incident raises critical questions about mine safety and the need for improved regulations.

item.title: Udit Narayan escapes after fire in his building, says incident affected him mentally: ‘Anything could’ve happened' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Udit Narayan Escapes Fire Incident That Affected Him Mentally

Date: Jan 08, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A fire broke out in a flat of the Sky Pan building in Mumbai, where singer Udit Narayan resides. The incident resulted in one death and one injury, affecting Narayan mentally.

  • The fire erupted in the B-wing of the building, while Narayan lives in the A-wing.
  • The incident led to the death of a 75-year-old man and injuries to a 38-year-old man.
  • The fire was extinguished after nearly four hours; it is suspected to have been caused by a short circuit.
  • Narayan expressed gratitude for safety but stated the incident had a profound mental impact on him.
  • The building's non-functional fire fighting system complicated the response to the fire.
“This incident has affected me mentally, and it will take a while to get over it.” - Udit Narayan

This fire incident has raised concerns about safety regulations and fire preparedness in residential buildings.

item.title: India on alert regarding China's proposed dam on Brahmaputra: Rajnath Singh - The Hindu
item.description:
India on Alert Regarding China's Proposed Mega Dam on Brahmaputra

Date: January 08, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh announced that the Indian government is monitoring China's plan to build a mega dam on the Brahmaputra river, indicating potential concerns for downstream water flow and regional security.

  • India is closely watching developments regarding China's planned mega dam on the Brahmaputra river.
  • The dam poses potential risks to water flow impacting downstream states, prompting the Indian government's alert stance.
  • Rajnath Singh emphasized, "The Indian government is on alert" regarding the construction.
  • Singh highlighted India's growing global presence and economic strength, aiming to rank among the top three economies in the near future.
  • He urged educators to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of students.
"Earlier, people did not take it seriously when India spoke at international forums, but now when India speaks, the world listens." - Rajnath Singh

The Indian government remains vigilant on the matter, reinforcing the importance of international dialogue concerning regional water resources.

item.title: Prashant Kishor's health stable, aides urge him to end fast - The Hindu
item.description:
Prashant Kishor's Health Condition Remains Stable Amid Fast

Publication Date: January 08, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The health of Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor is stable as he remains hospitalized after starting a fast unto death to support protesting candidates. Party leaders urge him to end his fast for his well-being.

  • Kishor was admitted to ICU after suffering from dehydration.
  • Leaders from his party urged him to begin eating normally to protect his health.
  • Doctors hope if his condition improves, he might be moved out of ICU soon.
  • Kishor was fasting in support of BPSC aspirants protesting the examination process.
  • His fast began on January 2, culminating in a hospital admission on January 7.
“His fight is commendable, but Bihar faces many problems and his well-being is necessary for a prolonged struggle.” - Pavan K Varma

In conclusion, while Kishor's health is stable, the ongoing protests underline significant issues regarding governance and public service examinations in Bihar.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi as temperature drops to 9°C, air quality remains in ‘poor category’ - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi wakes up to dense fog amid sharp drop in temperature

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Dense fog enveloped Delhi with visibility dropping to zero early Wednesday, accompanied by a significant drop in temperature.

  • Visibility in Palam dropped to 50 metres at midnight, returning to 500 metres by 2.30 am, and then falling to zero at 5.30 am.
  • The minimum temperature recorded was 7.4 degrees Celsius, slightly above normal.
  • The maximum temperature is projected to reach around 16 degrees Celsius on Wednesday.
  • The Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded was 334, categorizing it as 'very poor'.
“Palam’s visibility dropped to 50 metres at 12 midnight. It improved to 500 metres by 2.30 am, before dropping to zero at 5.30 am.” - India Meteorological Department (IMD)

The stark drop in temperature and the dense fog are notable developments for Delhi's winter season, impacting visibility and air quality.

item.title: After almost five decades, Congress to bid adieu to 24, Akbar Road, move into a new home - The Indian Express
item.description:
Congress Moves to New Headquarters After Decades at 24, Akbar Road

Date: January 15, 2024

Source: Indian Express

The Congress party is set to bid farewell to its long-standing headquarters at 24, Akbar Road in New Delhi as it prepares to inaugurate its new office, Indira Gandhi Bhawan, located at 9 A, Kotla Road. The shift marks the end of an era for the party, which has seen significant historical events unfold at the Akbar Road location.

  • The new headquarters has been under construction for 15 years and will be inaugurated on January 15.
  • Top Congress leaders, including AICC president Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi, are expected to attend the inauguration.
  • 24, Akbar Road has been the Congress headquarters since 1978, witnessing critical moments in Indian political history.
  • The party plans to retain the Akbar Road building for high-profile meetings.
“It is time for us to move ahead with the times and embrace the new.” - K C Venugopal, AICC General Secretary

The transition to the Indira Gandhi Bhawan symbolizes a modernization effort for the Congress party, aiming to create a workspace that caters to contemporary administrative and strategic needs.

item.title: Mumbai Weather and AQI Today: Warm start at 22.99 °C, check weather forecast for January 8, 2025 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mumbai Weather and AQI Today: Warm start at 22.99 °C, check weather forecast for January 8, 2025

Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Today's weather in Mumbai shows a warm start with temperatures reaching 25.38 °C. The city is experiencing moderate air quality, prompting caution for vulnerable groups.

  • Temperature Range: Minimum 22.99 °C, Maximum 26.62 °C.
  • Relative Humidity: 47%.
  • Wind Speed: 47 km/h.
  • Air Quality Index (AQI): 185, indicating moderate air quality.
  • Forecast for tomorrow predicts a temperature of 23.22 °C to 26.97 °C.
"Children and people with respiratory diseases should limit outdoor activity due to moderate air quality."

The weather forecast suggests plan accordingly for a sunny day, and enjoy the warm weather while being mindful of air quality.

item.title: The Hindu Morning Digest, January 8, 2024 - The Hindu
item.description:
The Hindu Morning Digest: Key Updates from January 8, 2024

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: The Hindu

This article provides a summary of significant events reported on January 8, 2024, including political actions, government decisions, and upcoming legal reviews.

  • General Strike Warning: 10 trade unions threaten to call a general strike if the Centre notifies new labour codes.
  • Pranab Mukherjee Memorial: The Centre has earmarked a site at Rajghat for erecting a memorial for former President Pranab Mukherjee.
  • UGC Draft Regulation: Students' body and teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments, criticizing it for centralizing power.
  • Sri Lanka-China Relations: Sri Lankan President Dissanayake is set to visit China from January 14.
  • Same-Sex Marriage Review: The Supreme Court will hear petitions on January 9 regarding the review of its previous ruling on same-sex marriage.
  • New ISRO Chief: Dr. V. Narayanan has been appointed as the new Space Secretary and ISRO Chairman.
  • AI Governance: An inter-ministerial committee is recommended to strengthen governance in AI by the Centre's IndiaAI Mission.
  • Bangladesh Political Turmoil: Bangladesh revokes the passport of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and others linked to protests.
  • IAF Chief Comments: IAF chief states that R&D loses relevance if it doesn't meet project timelines.
  • Allahabad High Court Ruling: Court dismisses plea against the impeachment motion for Justice Shekhar Yadav.
  • Supreme Court Recommendation: Collegium recommends Patna HC Chief Justice for appointment to the Supreme Court.
"Research and Development loses relevance if it does not meet timelines," - Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh.

In conclusion, the updates from January 8 demonstrate ongoing significant political discussions and actions affecting various sectors in India.

item.title: Delhi cold wave to intensify with temperatures set to plummet to 5 degrees this week - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Cold Wave to Intensify with Temperatures Set to Plummet to 5 Degrees This Week

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Meteorological Department forecasts a significant temperature drop in Delhi, with a minimum expected temperature of 5 degrees Celsius by Friday amidst adverse weather conditions.

  • Temperatures in Delhi are projected to decrease starting Wednesday.
  • The Safdarjung observatory recorded a maximum temperature of 16.2 degrees Celsius, above normal.
  • Air Quality Index (AQI) remains in the "very poor" category, measuring 335 on Monday.
  • Restrictions under Stage 1 and 2 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) still apply in Delhi-NCR.
  • Dense fog reduced visibility significantly, leading to the delay of 25 trains.
The IMD reported that minimum visibility was recorded at 500 meters at Safdarjung, and at Palam, visibility was as low as 150 meters.

This severe cold wave and deteriorating air quality highlight ongoing challenges for residents in Delhi due to adverse weather conditions.

item.title: Meet V Narayanan, who is set to succeed S Somanath as ISRO chief - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Meet V Narayanan, who is set to succeed S Somanath as ISRO chief

Date: Jan 08, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

V Narayanan has been appointed as the new chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), succeeding S Somanath, effective from January 14, 2025.

  • V Narayanan is a distinguished scientist with nearly four decades of experience in rocket and spacecraft propulsion.
  • He began his career at ISRO in 1984 and has since held various roles, including director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • Narayanan has made significant contributions in solid propulsion for sounding rockets and various launch vehicles.
  • He is currently the director of LPSC, with responsibilities for propelling India's space missions.
  • ISRO recently gained attention for launching SpaDex, an initiative that places India among countries with advanced space docking technology.
"The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved the appointment of Shri V. Narayanan...for a period of two years with effect from 14.01.2025, or until further orders, whichever is earlier.”

Narayanan's extensive experience is expected to guide ISRO through its upcoming ambitious projects, including Chandrayaan 4 and Gaganyaan.
